item.title: Joanna add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "But I don’t want to go among mad people," Alice remarked. "Oh, you can’t help that," said the Cat: "we’re all mad here. I’m mad. You’re mad." "How do you know I’m mad?" said Alice. "You must be," said the Cat, or you wouldn’t have come here." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Joanna add a quote by William Wordsworth
item.description: "Fill your paper with the breathings of your heart." -- William Wordsworth

item.title: Joanna add a quote by William Wordsworth
item.description: "Poetry is the first and last of all knowledge - it is as immortal as the heart of man." -- William Wordsworth

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Thomas Carlyle
item.description: "Wondrous indeed is the virtue of a true Book." -- Thomas Carlyle

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "I'm wondering what to read next." Matilda said. "I've finished all the children's books." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Joanna add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "The most valuable of all talents is that of never using two words when one will do." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Joanna add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "To the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure." -- J.K. Rowling
